org.xbib.marc.io

Interface InformationSeparator


  • public interface InformationSeparator
    An interface for Information separators for formatted data. Also known as control characters group 0 ("C0"), ASCII-1967 defines units, records, groups and files as separable hierarchically organized data structures. The structures are separated not by protocol, but by embedded separator codes. Originally, these codes were used to simulate punch card data on magnetic tape. Trailing blanks on tape could be saved by using separator characters instead.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      static char US
